examples: the size of the working population
the mill still has a working waterwheel

adjective.description: (of a theory, definition, or title) used as the basis for work or argument and likely to be developed, adapted, or improved later.
examples: the working hypothesis is tested and refined through discussion

noun.description: The way in which a machine, organization, or system operates.
examples: we will be less secretive about the workings of government

noun.description: A mine or a part of a mine from which minerals are being extracted.
